actions.description: Sends an email via Gmail API using the authenticated user's Google profile display name. At least one of recipient_email, cc, or bcc must be provided. Atleast one of subject or body must be provided. Requires `is_html=True` if the body contains HTML and valid `s3key`, `mimetype`, `name` for any attachment.
actions.docstring:
Description:
    Sends an email via Gmail API using the authenticated user's Google profile display name. At least one of recipient_email, cc, or bcc must be provided. Atleast one of subject or body must be provided. Requires `is_html=True` if the body contains HTML and valid `s3key`, `mimetype`, `name` for any attachment.
Args:
    to: Comma-separated recipients.
    subject: Subject line text.
    body: Plain text or simple HTML body.
    cc: Optional comma-separated CC recipients.
    bcc: Optional comma-separated BCC recipients.
    thread_id: Optional Gmail thread to reply into.
    is_html: Optional boolean indicating if the body contains HTML.
actions.name: gmail_send_email

parameters.description: Comma-separated recipients.
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: Subject line text.
parameters.name: subject

parameters.description: Plain text or simple HTML body.
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: Optional comma-separated CC recipients.
parameters.name: cc

parameters.description: Optional comma-separated BCC recipients.
parameters.name: bcc

parameters.description: Optional Gmail thread to reply into.
parameters.name: thread_id

parameters.description: Optional boolean indicating if the body contains HTML.
parameters.name: is_html

actions.python_signature: gmail_send_email(self, to: str, subject: str, body: str, cc: str = '', bcc: str = '', thread_id: str = '', is_html: bool = False)
actions.short_description: Sends an email via Gmail API using the authenticated user's Google profile display name

actions.description: Fetches a list of email messages from a Gmail account, supporting filtering, pagination, and optional full content retrieval.
actions.docstring:
Description:
    Fetches a list of email messages from a Gmail account, supporting filtering, pagination, and optional full content retrieval.
Args:
    query: Required Gmail search query (e.g., 'from:alice has:attachment').
    max_results: Optional maximum number of results to return (defaults to 20, API default 1).
    label_ids: Optional comma-separated string or iterable of label IDs to include.
    page_token: Optional pagination token from a previous response.
    include_payload: Optional flag to return full MIME payloads.
    include_spam_trash: Optional flag to include spam and trash.
    ids_only: Optional flag to return only message ids/snippets.
    verbose: Optional flag for verbose response metadata.
    user_id: Optional Gmail user identifier (defaults to 'me').
actions.name: gmail_search

parameters.description: Required Gmail search query (e.g., 'from:alice has:attachment').
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: Optional maximum number of results to return (defaults to 20, API default 1).
parameters.name: max_results

parameters.description: Optional comma-separated string or iterable of label IDs to include.
parameters.name: label_ids

parameters.description: Optional pagination token from a previous response.
parameters.name: page_token

parameters.description: Optional flag to return full MIME payloads.
parameters.name: include_payload

parameters.description: Optional flag to include spam and trash.
parameters.name: include_spam_trash

parameters.description: Optional flag to return only message ids/snippets.
parameters.name: ids_only

parameters.description: Optional flag for verbose response metadata.
parameters.name: verbose

parameters.description: Optional Gmail user identifier (defaults to 'me').
parameters.name: user_id

actions.python_signature: gmail_search(self, query: str, max_results: int = 20, *, label_ids: typing.Any | None = None, page_token: str | None = None, include_payload: bool | None = None, include_spam_trash: bool | None = None, ids_only: bool | None = None, verbose: bool | None = None, user_id: str = 'me')
actions.short_description: Fetches a list of email messages from a Gmail account, supporting filtering, pagination, and optional full content retrieval

actions.description: Posts a message to a Slack channel, direct message, or private group; requires content via `text`, `blocks`, or `attachments`.
actions.docstring:
Description:
    Posts a message to a Slack channel, direct message, or private group; requires content via `text`, `blocks`, or `attachments`.
Args:
    channel: Required channel ID or name (e.g., '#ops').
    text: Optional plain-text body for the message.
    markdown_text: Optional markdown-formatted body (`markdown_text` field).
    blocks: Optional Block Kit payload as JSON string or serializable object.
    attachments: Optional legacy attachments JSON string or serializable object.
    thread_ts: Optional parent message timestamp for threaded replies.
    reply_broadcast: Optional flag to broadcast the thread reply back to the channel.
    as_user: Optional flag to post as the authenticated Slack user.
    username: Optional bot username override (requires `as_user=False`).
    icon_emoji: Optional emoji icon string (e.g., ':robot_face:').
    icon_url: Optional image URL to use as the icon.
    link_names: Optional flag to expand channel/user mentions in `text`.
    parse: Optional Slack parse mode ('none' or 'full').
    mrkdwn: Optional flag to enable markdown parsing within blocks.
    unfurl_links: Optional flag to unfurl links contained in attachments.
    unfurl_media: Optional flag to unfurl media content contained in attachments.
actions.name: slack_post_message

parameters.description: Required channel ID or name (e.g., '#ops').
parameters.name: channel

parameters.description: Optional plain-text body for the message.
parameters.name: text

parameters.description: Optional markdown-formatted body (`markdown_text` field).
parameters.name: markdown_text

parameters.description: Optional Block Kit payload as JSON string or serializable object.
parameters.name: blocks

parameters.description: Optional legacy attachments JSON string or serializable object.
parameters.name: attachments

parameters.description: Optional parent message timestamp for threaded replies.
parameters.name: thread_ts

parameters.description: Optional flag to broadcast the thread reply back to the channel.
parameters.name: reply_broadcast

parameters.description: Optional flag to post as the authenticated Slack user.
parameters.name: as_user

parameters.description: Optional bot username override (requires `as_user=False`).
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: Optional emoji icon string (e.g., ':robot_face:').
parameters.name: icon_emoji

parameters.description: Optional image URL to use as the icon.
parameters.name: icon_url

parameters.description: Optional flag to expand channel/user mentions in `text`.
parameters.name: link_names

parameters.description: Optional Slack parse mode ('none' or 'full').
parameters.name: parse

parameters.description: Optional flag to enable markdown parsing within blocks.
parameters.name: mrkdwn

parameters.description: Optional flag to unfurl links contained in attachments.
parameters.name: unfurl_links

parameters.description: Optional flag to unfurl media content contained in attachments.
parameters.name: unfurl_media

actions.python_signature: slack_post_message(self, channel: str, text: str = '', *, markdown_text: str = '', blocks: typing.Any | None = None, attachments: typing.Any | None = None, thread_ts: str | None = None, reply_broadcast: bool | None = None, as_user: bool | None = None, username: str | None = None, icon_emoji: str | None = None, icon_url: str | None = None, link_names: bool | None = None, parse: str | None = None, mrkdwn: bool | None = None, unfurl_links: bool | None = None, unfurl_media: bool | None = None)
actions.short_description: Posts a message to a Slack channel, direct message, or private group; requires content via `text`, `blocks`, or `attachments`

actions.description: Workspace-wide Slack message search with query modifiers (e.g., `in:#channel`, `from:@user`, `before:YYYY-MM-DD`) plus pagination and sorting controls.
actions.docstring:
Description:
    Workspace-wide Slack message search with query modifiers (e.g., `in:#channel`, `from:@user`, `before:YYYY-MM-DD`) plus pagination and sorting controls.
Args:
    query: Required Slack search query string.
    count: Optional number of results per page (defaults to 20, Slack default 1).
    page: Optional page index for paginated results.
    sort: Optional sort field ('score' or 'timestamp').
    sort_dir: Optional direction ('asc' or 'desc').
    highlight: Optional flag to return highlighted contexts.
    auto_paginate: Optional flag to iterate through all result pages.
actions.name: slack_search_messages

parameters.description: Required Slack search query string.
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: Optional number of results per page (defaults to 20, Slack default 1).
parameters.name: count

parameters.description: Optional page index for paginated results.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Optional sort field ('score' or 'timestamp').
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: Optional direction ('asc' or 'desc').
parameters.name: sort_dir

parameters.description: Optional flag to return highlighted contexts.
parameters.name: highlight

parameters.description: Optional flag to iterate through all result pages.
parameters.name: auto_paginate

actions.python_signature: slack_search_messages(self, query: str, *, count: int = 20, page: int | None = None, sort: str | None = None, sort_dir: str | None = None, highlight: bool | None = None, auto_paginate: bool | None = None)
actions.short_description: Workspace-wide Slack message search with query modifiers (e.g., `in:#channel`, `from:@user`, `before:YYYY-MM-DD`) plus pagination and sorting controls
